bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to James G. Blaine, June 2, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Legation of the United States. Monrovia, Liberia, June 2nd 1891
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State
Legation of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, June 2nd 1891
Hon. James G. Blaine Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: It is my painful duty to inform you that Alexamde Clark, Esquire, United States Minister Resident and Consul General for the Government of Liberia, departed this life at the Legation, on the 31st silt., at 8 AM and his remains were interred on the 1st instant. The President of Liberia, members of his cabinet, all Diplomatic Representatives in the city, were in attendence at the funeral, and Military and Marine honors were shown him.
I have instructed Consul Bourat, at Sierra Leone to cablegram this sad --
sad intelligance to the Department of State at Washington, D. C.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant
Beverly Y. Payne U.S. Vice Consul General.
